about.description:
This is a mini-library which, given a package name and a version,
checks if it's the latest version available on PyPI.
about.summary: Check if a version of a PyPI package is outdated

name: outdated
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "outdated" %}
{% set version = "0.2.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: bcb145e0e372ba467e998c327d3d1ba72a134b0d5a729749729df6c6244ce643

build:
  noarch: python
  number: 0
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv"

requirements:
  host:
    - python
    - pip
  run:
    - python
    - littleutils
    - requests

test:
  imports:
    - outdated

about:
  home: https://github.com/alexmojaki/outdated
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  # PR to include license file upstream: https://github.com/alexmojaki/outdated/pull/4
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: 'Check if a version of a PyPI package is outdated'
  description: |
    This is a mini-library which, given a package name and a version,
    checks if it's the latest version available on PyPI.

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - hoechenberger
